channel.description:
**The Queen** **Faction:** Neutral(Cannot be converted) **Type:** Special
**Passive Abillity 1**: The First Maiden You cannot step up to become the next King.Immune to Occupation.After using ''Grand Entrance'' your vote will count as 2. **Passive Abillity 2:** Royal Sense All players with Royal Blood will have a sign next to their name(Blood drop).You don't see their class and faction even if they got converted.
**Day Ability 1:** Private Conversation Choose a player and talk to him next night.Targered player will see you as "Queen" in night chat and unable to use Night Abilities.Anyone who try visit Queen or her Target will be prevented.(1-Day-Cooldown) Note: She cannot target The King. If she pick The Prince or his target, ability will fail(She will got a message at night phase) **Day Ability 2:** Grand Entrance Reveal yourself to the court as "Quenn"(Crown next to name).You cannot whisper and receive whispers to you.Remove ''Private Conversation'' and change ''Watchful Spy'' into ''Personal Guardsman''.Upgrade passive abillity ''The First Maiden''
**Night Ability 1:** Watchful Spy Discover a class of a player with Royal Blood.See who they visit and who visited them at this night.(3-Uses) **Night Ability 2:** Personal Guardsman Protect a player with Royal Blood from first attack,killing a player who attempt to kill her target.Can target herself.(4-Uses) Note: Does not bypass night immunity.Attacker with night immunity will be prevented from killing Queen's target.
Objective:At least one of the players with Royal Blood or Starter King need survive until the end of the game,in order to win.(Next Kings won't count unless they had Royal Blood)
Personal Thoughts:I browsed any suggestions about ''Queen'' Class before i came up with this idea.I wondered why there isn't this character (King's Wife) in a game.What do you guys thing this?Any comments and good criticism is appreciated. :grinning:

item.title: [Suggestion]The Queen
item.dc:creator: Cameron_McKenzie
item.description:
I don’t think outing yourself as a royal (that isn’t prince) is risky at all.

Attacking someone who is very likely to be a princess is extremely dangerous, and if there are few royal claims, the queen can easily (too easily) protect using private conversation.

You are correct that a queen probably won’t out a royal who’s been converted, but simply knowing that the person in question began the game as BD is helpful enough (since they will be good targets for barrier, smite, and scout)

Having the queen lose if she does makes her win con a little more reasonable, but there’s little incesntive to kill her, she can guard herself with private conversation every other night, and guard herself 4 times after revealing, so even trying to kill her seems like a bad idea. Prince/King obviously won’t want to kill her since she will help the Prince/King, and there’s really no reason for BD to vote her out.

A neutral who appears royal could help thwart the strategy, but more than likely that neutral just won’t claim when the queen asks for nobles to claim, and the queen won’t out them. The BD royals still claim and get all of the advantages of having the queen direct their actions.

Making the prince unable to jail the queen is pointless. No good prince would jail a queen claim in the first place unless she was asked to make an entrance and refused (in which case she’s probably not actually a queen)

item.title: [Suggestion]The Queen
item.dc:creator: Cameron_McKenzie
item.description:
Probably too helpful to BD, and too easy to win (easier win con and more power than a mercenary)

I could see this being a common play:
1.) Queen claims day 1, asks all royals except prince to claim without giving class.
2.) Queen confirms true claims (known BD) and refutes false claims
3.) Queen tells each royal who to target, and tells prince (without outing) who to target.

In this way, the prince, drunks, and princesses aren’t wasting their abilities on confirmed royals and aren’t targeting the same people = very high probability of an evil being debbed or jailed.

The drunks or princess could be converted later, but knowing a handful of ppl that started as BD is immensely helpful.

The fact that the queen can confirm herself very easily means an evil playing at Queen is not going to get much out of it, so the BD has no reason not to go along with it.

(Worst case scenario is that an evil claiming queen outs a bunch of royals, but as that will not include the prince, it isn’t that bad)
